comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: One possibility is that this is Mrs. William Cheney Ellis, the former Eleanor Hosea, of Cincinnati. She was murdered by her husband in October 1913. According to "King of the bootleggers: a biography of George Remus, " they had children Eleanor (2) and Violet (6) at the time. See books.google.com/books?id=zmaXU8H3EUgC&pg=PA11&lp...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Bain's copy negative bears the date 3/3/14 -- this was a day or two before the end of Mr. Ellis' trial, when he was sentenced to 15 years in prison, escaping the death penalty by reason of temporary insanity. He got out in 1921. (Bain must have reused the photo in March, 1914 -- his clerk had neglected to date the photo at the time of its first use, in October, 1913.)

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Swang: Thanks for the information about Mrs. William Cheney Ellis.It seems possible that this is a picture of her.
